item.description:
On this day in 1938 what came to be known as the Great Hurricane of 1938 plowed into Long Island and wreaked havoc in New England. It had been mostly ignored, pre-satellite days as they were, and there were bigger things going on in Europe to take up the front page of the newspaper.

We don't appear to have any storms coming in on Tuesday, but we'll have exercises and writing prompts to try to kick up a storm of ideas. Hopefully we won't cause any destruction or power outages, but we may get moving mentally.

It's getting dark earlier, the Equinox is Wednesday, so we'll meet inside this week unless it's particularly warm and people want to move outside.

If you have any ideas for exercises, send an email with them to Sarah ahead of time, or bring them with you.
item.name: Storms of ideas
